issues: Mule networks typically require more entities (5 is low for realistic complexity)
15 transactions is insufficient for a layered mule network typology
No geographic jurisdiction details provided (critical for mule network realism)
Entity-to-account ratio (2 accounts per entity) may be too simplistic
Lack of temporal details (dates/timing) prevents verification of transaction sequence
suggestions: Add 3-5 more entities to create a more complex network structure
Increase transactions to 30-50 to show proper layering
Specify jurisdictions across multiple countries with different regulatory regimes
Include shell company entities with no legitimate business activity
Add transaction dates showing staggered timing across weeks/months
